1: <sup>1</sup> We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us, what work thou didst in their days, in the times of old.
2: <sup>2</sup> How thou didst drive out the heathen with thy hand, and plantedst them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.
3: <sup>3</sup> For they got not the land in possession by their own sword, neither did their own arm save them: but thy right hand, and thine arm, and the light of thy countenance, because thou hadst a favour unto them.
4: <sup>4</sup> Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob.
5: <sup>5</sup> Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name will we tread them under that rise up against us.
6: <sup>6</sup> For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
7: <sup>7</sup> But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to shame that hated us.
8: <sup>8</sup> In God we boast all the day long, and praise thy name for ever. Selah.
9: <sup>9</sup> But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth with our armies.
10: <sup>10</sup> Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate us spoil for themselves.
11: <sup>11</sup> Thou hast given us like sheep appointed for meat; and hast scattered us among the heathen.
12: <sup>12</sup> Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase thy wealth by their price.
13: <sup>13</sup> Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a derision to them that are round about us.
14: <sup>14</sup> Thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shaking of the head among the people.
15: <sup>15</sup> My confusion is continually before me, and the shame of my face hath covered me,
16: <sup>16</sup> For the voice of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason of the enemy and avenger.
17: <sup>17</sup> All this is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we dealt falsely in thy covenant.
18: <sup>18</sup> Our heart is not turned back, neither have our steps declined from thy way;
19: <sup>19</sup> Though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and covered us with the shadow of death.
20: <sup>20</sup> If we have forgotten the name of our God, or stretched out our hands to a strange god;
21: <sup>21</sup> Shall not God search this out? for he knoweth the secrets of the heart.
22: <sup>22</sup> Yea, for thy sake are we killed all the day long; we are counted as sheep for the slaughter.
23: <sup>23</sup> Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast us not off for ever.
24: <sup>24</sup> Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and forgettest our affliction and our oppression?
25: <sup>25</sup> For our soul is bowed down to the dust: our belly cleaveth unto the earth.
26: <sup>26</sup> Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.
